oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Einfluss von ligninhaltigen Komposten und Pflanzgutgesundheit auf den Befall mit Rhizoctonia solani bei Kartoffeln
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Schulte-Geldermann, Elmar
Bruns, Dr. Christian
Heß, Prof. Dr. Jürgen
Finckh, Prof. Dr. Maria Renate
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Crop health, quality, protection
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The effects of initial seed potato infection and suppressive composts made of mixtures of organic household and yard waste on the R. solani severity in potatoes were tested in field trials under organic conditions at the University Kassel in the years 2006-08 and at two sites in northern Germany in 2008. Composts directly applied in strips to the seed tuber area at 5 t dry matter ha-1 significantly reduced both the infestation of harvested potatoes with black scurf and the percentage of tubers with malformations and dry core The rate of initial seed tubers infection and the site significantly affected tuber health and quality.
oai_dc:dc.dc:identifier: Schulte-Geldermann, Elmar; Bruns, Dr. Christian; Heß, Prof. Dr. Jürgen and Finckh, Prof. Dr. Maria Renate (2009) Einfluss von ligninhaltigen Komposten und Pflanzgutgesundheit auf den Befall mit Rhizoctonia solani bei Kartoffeln. Paper at: 10. Wissenschaftstagung Ökologischer Landbau, Zürich, 11.-13. Februar 2009.
